channel.title: Comments on: Azure DevOps Pipelines: Variables, $Variables, __Variables__, $env:Variables, $(Variables), %VARIABLES%
channel.description: A blog about things I learn at the keyboard: DevOps, CI/CD, Cloud, Automation, to name a few....

item.title: By: Leif
item.dc:creator: Leif
item.description: Maybe a post on the scope of variables, over-riding a global variable with a stage or job-specific value, working with variables containing secrets, and the life-cycles of variables (compile-time vs runtime). Also if you use YAML templates, different strategies for passing variables between templates
item.content:encoded: Maybe a post on the scope of variables, over-riding a global variable with a stage or job-specific value, working with variables containing secrets, and the life-cycles of variables (compile-time vs runtime). Also if you use YAML templates, different strategies for passing variables between templates

item.title: By: Zafar
item.dc:creator: Zafar
item.description:
Hi ,
I have a repository containing a xml file with key value pair like (), can we extract this value (revision, name ) and store in pipeline variables or variables group ?please assist
item.content:encoded:
Hi ,

I have a repository containing a xml file with key value pair like (), can we extract this value (revision, name ) and store in pipeline variables or variables group ?please assist

item.title: By: Willian
item.dc:creator: Willian
item.description:
Hey! Is it possible to edit a variable value? Like, I'd like to set a variable value during the build and read it during the release, however, this value have to be stored somewhere for future releases.
Thank you!
item.content:encoded:
Hey!
Is it possible to edit a variable value?
Like, I’d like to set a variable value during the build and read it during the release, however, this value have to be stored somewhere for future releases.

Thank you!
